text: Jiří Menzel () (23 February 1938 – 5 September 2020) was a Czech movie director, theatre director, actor, and screenwriter. He directed the 1966 movie Closely Watched Trains, which won the Academy Award for Best International Feature Film. He was also known for directing Larks on a String and My Sweet Little Village. Menzel was born in Prague. Menzel died on 5 September 2020 in Prague from a long-illness, aged 82. His wife confirmed two months later that Menzel died from COVID-19. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1938 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Prague Category:Czech movie directors Category:Czech screenwriters Category:Czech movie actors Category:Czech theatre directors Category:Writers from Prague
title: Jiří Menzel
